CatDescriptText: Calvin Reed, laborer, Homeville and Robert Knox, Third Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 14, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "At what age should young folks be allowed to have unchaperoned parties?" Calvin Reed's answer reads: "I think they should be around 18.  At that age they know how to take care of themselves a little better than at 14 or 16 years of age."  Robert Knox's answer reads: "Around 18.  At that age, girls and boys should both know how to take care of themselves and how to act."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Calvin Reed wearing eyeglasses, moustache, light colored shirt, and jacket, standing on sidewalk in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Robert Knox wearing dark fedora, eyeglasses, dark shirt, sweater, and herringbone coat, standing in front of textured building
